title: Hillrom Progressa Hospital Bed - Bed Won’t Move / Functions Intermittently
description: Guide for troubleshooting a Hillrom Progressa hospital bed that fails to respond, moves intermittently, or stops functioning.

steps.title: Verify Power Connection
steps.instructions: Confirm the bed is plugged into a live outlet or that its battery is charged. Check that the bed’s power cord is intact and fully seated. Why: Intermittent function is often caused by loose connections or depleted batteries.

steps.title: Check Bed Control Handset and Panel
steps.instructions: Inspect the handset for visible damage, frayed wires, or stuck buttons. Test all functions to see if some movements work while others don’t. Why: A malfunctioning handset can mimic pump failure.

steps.title: Inspect Fuses and Circuit Breakers
steps.instructions: Locate and check the bed’s internal fuses or reset any circuit breakers on the bed. Why: A blown fuse can prevent the pump from running or limit certain functions.

steps.title: Observe Mechanical Movement
steps.instructions: Ensure no bed rails, linens, or accessories are obstructing actuator movement. Check that wheels are properly locked/unlocked depending on intended movement. Why: Mechanical obstructions can prevent the bed from moving even if the pump is working.

steps.title: Test Battery (if applicable)
steps.instructions: If the bed has a battery pack, verify charge using the built-in indicator. Swap with a known-good battery if available. Why: Weak batteries often cause intermittent operation or slow movement.

steps.title: Listen for Pump Motor Activation
steps.instructions: Press a function button and listen for any motor sound. No sound may indicate electrical/pump failure. Why: Confirms whether the issue is electrical or mechanical.

steps.title: Inspect Wiring and Connections
steps.instructions: Check cables between the pump, handset, and motor assembly for loose or disconnected plugs. Why: Disconnected or damaged wires are a common cause of intermittent operation.

CCR.Complaint: Bed fails to respond to handset commands; functions intermittently.
CCR.Cause: Bed confirmed plugged in; handset buttons tested; no visible obstructions; fuses intact; pump motor silent.
CCR.Resolution: Bed removed from service, labeled Out of Service, and sent for repair.

helpfulDetails: Motor activation attempted, no sound heard
Final device status: Out of Service
